availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John McAuley Palmer (Military Governor of Kentucky)

body.p: Carlinville, Illinois, attorney, soldier, and politician. Eagle Creek, Kentucky, native. Attorney in Carlinville, Illinois, in 1840. Delegate to the state constitutional convention in 1847. Member of the state senate from 1852 to 1854. Delegate to the National Republican convention at Philadelphia in 1856. Presidential elector to the Republican ticket of 1860. Delegate to the Peace convention in Washington, D.C., on February 4th, 1861. Colonel, brigadier general, and major general of the 14th Illinois Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from 1861 to 1866. Military Governor of Kentucky in early 1865.

ab.bibl:
George T. Palmer, A Conscientious Turncoat: The Story of John M. Palmer, 1817-1900. (New Haven: Yale University Press, 1941).
John M. Palmer, Personal Recollections of John M. Palmer: The Story of an Ernest Life. (Cincinnati: R. Clarke Co., 1901).
"John McCauley Palmer," Appletons' Cyclopedia of American Biography (1600-1889), vol. 4, 640.
Find a Grave, John McAuley Palmer (1817-1900), Memorial #5895174, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5895174/john-mcauley-palmer (accessed July 20, 2017).
